00040 /**
00041  * @file
00042  * Function prototypes for accessing memory and CSRs on Octeon.
00043  *
00044  * <hr>$Revision: 38306 $<hr>
00045 */
00046 #ifndef __CVMX_ACCESS_H__
00047 #define __CVMX_ACCESS_H__
00048 
00049 #ifdef  __cplusplus
00050 /* *INDENT-OFF* */
00051 extern "C" {
00052 /* *INDENT-ON* */
00053 #endif
00054 
00055 /* We're going to assume that if we are compiling for Mips then we must be
00056     running natively on Octoen. It is possible that this code could be
00057     compiled on a non Octeon Mips that is acting as a PCI/PCIe host. In this
00058     case this assumption will be wrong and cause issues We can't key off of
00059     __octeon__ since some people use stock gcc toolchains */
00060 #if defined(__mips__) && !defined(CVMX_BUILD_FOR_LINUX_HOST)
00061 #define CVMX_FUNCTION static inline
00062 #else
00063 #define CVMX_FUNCTION extern
00064 #endif
00065 
00066 /**
00067  * simprintf uses simulator tricks to speed up printouts.  The format
00068  * and args are passed to the simulator and processed natively on the host.
00069  * Simprintf is limited to 7 arguments, and they all must use %ll (long long)
00070  * format specifiers to be displayed correctly.
00071  *
00072  * @param format
00073  *
00074  * @return
00075  */
00076 EXTERN_ASM void simprintf(const char *format, ...);
00077 
00078 /**
00079  * This function performs some default initialization of the Octeon executive.
00080  * It initializes the cvmx_bootmem memory allocator with the list of physical
00081  * memory provided by the bootloader, and creates 1-1 TLB mappings for this
00082  * memory. This function should be called on all cores that will use either the
00083  * bootmem allocator or the 1-1 TLB mappings. Applications which require a
00084  * different configuration can replace this function with a suitable application
00085  * specific one.
00086  *
00087  * @return 0 on success
00088  *         -1 on failure
00089  */
00090 extern int cvmx_user_app_init(void);
00091 
00092 /**
00093  * Returns the Octeon processor ID.
00094  *
00095  * @return Octeon processor ID from COP0
00096  */
00097 CVMX_FUNCTION uint32_t cvmx_get_proc_id(void) __attribute__ ((pure));
00098 
00099 /**
00100  * Convert a memory pointer (void*) into a hardware compatable
00101  * memory address (uint64_t). Octeon hardware widgets don't
00102  * understand logical addresses.
00103  *
00104  * @param ptr    C style memory pointer
00105  * @return Hardware physical address
00106  */
00107 #ifndef __OPTIMIZE_SIZE__
00108 CVMX_FUNCTION
00109 #endif
00110     uint64_t cvmx_ptr_to_phys(void *ptr);
00111 
00112 /**
00113  * Convert a hardware physical address (uint64_t) into a
00114  * memory pointer (void *).
00115  *
00116  * @param physical_address
00117  *               Hardware physical address to memory
00118  * @return Pointer to memory
00119  */
00120 #ifndef __OPTIMIZE_SIZE__
00121 CVMX_FUNCTION
00122 #endif
00123 void *cvmx_phys_to_ptr(uint64_t physical_address);

00152 /**
00153  * Perform a background I/O read operation
00154  *
00155  * @param node      node to read from
00156  * @param srcaddr   Starting location where the core puts the result
00157  *          0xFFFFFFFFFFFF8000 + (8 * srcaddr)
00158  * @param csr_addr  Address of CSR to read
00159  */
00160 CVMX_FUNCTION void cvmx_read_csr_async_node(uint8_t node, uint64_t srcaddr,
00161                         uint64_t csr_addr);

00165  *
00166  * @return Global core number
00167  */
00168 CVMX_FUNCTION unsigned int cvmx_get_core_num(void);

00171  * Number of the node-local Core on which the program is currently running.
00172  *
00173  * @return Node-local core number
00174  */
00175 CVMX_FUNCTION unsigned int cvmx_get_local_core_num(void);
00176 
00177 /**
00178  * Number of the node on which the program is currently running.
00179  *
00180  * @return current node number
00181  */
00182 CVMX_FUNCTION unsigned int cvmx_get_node_num(void);
00183 
00184 /**
00185  * Returns the number of bits set in the provided value.
00186  * Simple wrapper for POP instruction.
00187  *
00188  * @param val    32 bit value to count set bits in
00189  *
00190  * @return Number of bits set
00191  */
00192 CVMX_FUNCTION uint32_t cvmx_pop(uint32_t val);
00193 
00194 /**
00195  * Returns the number of bits set in the provided value.
00196  * Simple wrapper for DPOP instruction.
00197  *
00198  * @param val    64 bit value to count set bits in
00199  *
00200  * @return Number of bits set
00201  */
00202 CVMX_FUNCTION int cvmx_dpop(uint64_t val);
00203 
00204 /**
00205  * @deprecated
00206  * Provide current cycle counter as a return value. Deprecated, use
00207  * cvmx_clock_get_count(CVMX_CLOCK_CORE) to get cycle counter.
00208  *
00209  * @return current cycle counter
00210  */
00211 CVMX_FUNCTION uint64_t cvmx_get_cycle(void);
00212 
00213 /**
00214  * @deprecated
00215  * Reads a chip global cycle counter.  This counts SCLK cycles since
00216  * chip reset.  The counter is 64 bit. This function is deprecated as the rate
00217  * of the global cycle counter is different between Octeon+ and Octeon2, use
00218  * cvmx_clock_get_count(CVMX_CLOCK_SCLK) instead. For Octeon2, the clock rate
00219  * of SCLK may be differnet than the core clock.
00220  *
00221  * @return Global chip cycle count since chip reset.
00222  */
00223 CVMX_FUNCTION uint64_t cvmx_get_cycle_global(void) __attribute__ ((deprecated));
00224 
00225 /**
00226  * Wait for the specified number of core clock cycles
00227  *
00228  * @param cycles
00229  */
00230 CVMX_FUNCTION void cvmx_wait(uint64_t cycles);

00233  * Wait for the specified number of micro seconds
00234  *
00235  * @param usec   micro seconds to wait
00236  */
00237 #ifndef __OPTIMIZE_SIZE__
00238 CVMX_FUNCTION
00239 #endif
00240 void cvmx_wait_usec(uint64_t usec);

00243  * Wait for the specified number of io clock cycles

00247 CVMX_FUNCTION void cvmx_wait_io(uint64_t cycles);

00254 CVMX_FUNCTION void cvmx_reset_octeon(void);

00256 /**
00257  * Read a byte of fuse data
00258  * @param byte_addr   address to read
00259  *
00260  * @return fuse value: 0 or 1
00261  */
00262 CVMX_FUNCTION uint8_t cvmx_fuse_read_byte(int byte_addr);
00263 
00264 /**
00265  * Read a byte of fuse data
00266  * @param node      node to read from
00267  * @param byte_addr address to read
00268  *
00269  * @return fuse value: 0 or 1
00270  */
00271 CVMX_FUNCTION uint8_t cvmx_fuse_read_byte_node(uint8_t node, int byte_addr);
00272 
00273 /**
00274  * Read a single fuse bit
00275  *
00276  * @param fuse   Fuse number (0-1024)
00277  *
00278  * @return fuse value: 0 or 1
00279  */
00280 CVMX_FUNCTION int cvmx_fuse_read(int fuse);
